p: THC has the potential to deal with multidrug resistance in cancer in a unique way. It caused cell death through autophagy in Ara-C-resistant acute myeloid leukemia cancer cells [ 64]. The photoactive metal complex of THC exhibited phototoxicity, which may have potential applications in photodynamic therapy [ 65]. In a study, THC-loaded vaginal nanomicrobicide demonstrated the gp120-CD4 binding inhibitory ability, which showed its potential in the prophylaxis of HIV-1 infection associated with unprotected sex [ 66]. Carboxymethylcellulose-THC, a synthetic conjugate prodrug, possessed targeted drug delivery capacity for colon cancer therapy even better than curcumin and THC [ 67].
